radiographic_examinations.findings: Small amount of pleural effusion tracking along the left major fissure; three hypodense lesions in the liver, with the largest measuring 1.7 x 1.5 cm, likely a hepatic cyst; duodenal wall thickening abutting the tumor, unchanged; large heterogeneous lesion in the pancreatic head measuring 4.4 x 4.1 x 4.3 cm, essentially unchanged in appearance from a study two days ago; normal intra-abdominal vascular anatomy; tiny retrocrural node measuring 12 x 4 mm; no free fluid or air noted; multilevel degenerative changes are mild.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The large heterogeneous lesion in the pancreatic head is essentially unchanged in appearance compared to the study two days ago; duodenal wall thickening is also unchanged.
